page.title: 15LONGSTANTON TRAFFIC
page.content: Nearly every Longstanton family has a car. Two or even three cars in a family is not uncommon. Nearly everyone in a job leaves the village daily. And Longstanton is on the route from Over and Willingham to the A604. The result, obviously, is busy roads. We counted the traffic at a peak time: between 8 and 9 on a weekday morning. We found 355 vehicles came in from Willingham, and 248 from Over. 808 left the village: averaging one every five seconds. And these joined 3807 an hour on the A604- 2245 travelling towards Cambridge and 1562 towards Huntingdon. Longstanton drivers tell us that they meet few serious hold-ups: Cambridge in 20 minutes seems pretty general. But it is careful nose-to- tail motoring all the way.
